oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Event-by-Event Study of Space-Time Dynamics in Flux-Tube Fragmentation
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wong, Cheuk-Yin
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: High Energy Physics - Phenomenology
Nuclear Theory
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In the semi-classical description of the flux-tube fragmentation process for hadron production in high-energy $e^+e^-$ annihilation and $pp$ collisions, the rapidity-space-time ordering and the local conservation laws of charge, flavor, and momentum provide a set of powerful tools that may allow the reconstruction of the space-time dynamics of quarks and mesons in exclusive measurements of produced hadrons on an event-by-event basis. As a supplementary tool, we write down the differential equation relating the average space-time coordinates of the $q$-$\bar q$ pair production vertices to the rapidity distribution of produced hadrons. We infer the average space-time coordinates of the $q$-$\bar q$ pair production vertices in $pp$ collisions at $\sqrt{s}$ = 6.3 to 17.3 GeV from the $\pi^-$ rapidity distribution data obtained by the NA61/SHINE Collaboration. We propose procedures to reconstruct the space-time coordinates of $q$-$\bar q$ pair production vertices from event-by-event exclusive hadron data to exhibit explicitly the ordered chain of hadrons produced in a flux tube fragmentation.
